alert.note: Alert for Southern Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 11:19AM EST until February 23 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of around two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern Connecticut including southern Litchfield County, and east central New York including the Capital District, Helderbergs, Taconics, Catskills, Mohawk and Schoharie Valleys and portions of the mid- Hudson Valley. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 10 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will overspread the area after 2 pm. The snow could briefly mix with rain this afternoon over lower elevations. The snow will accumulate 1 to 4 inches this evening with snowfall rates as high as 0.5 to 1.0 inches per hour, then change to sleet and freezing rain from south to north later this evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
